member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Action
member.summary: An action performed by a direct agent and indirect participants upon a direct object. Optionally happens at a location with the help of an inanimate instrument. The execution of the action may produce a result. Specific action sub-type documentation specifies the exact expectation of each argument/role. See also blog post and Actions overview document.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Thing
member.summary: The most generic type of item.

member.name: M:MXTires.Microdata.Thing.ToJson
member.summary: Returns Json string that represents current object. JSON written by the serializer with an option of Formatting.None and NullValueHandling.Ignore. It makes the JSON result small, skipping all unnecessary spaces and line breaks to produce the most compact and efficient JSON possible.

member.name: M:MXTires.Microdata.Thing.ToIndentedJson
member.summary: Returns Json string that represents current object. JSON written by the serializer with an option of Formatting.Indented produces nicely formatted, easy to read JSON – great when you are developing.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Thing.AdditionalType
member.summary: URL An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Thing.AlternateName
member.summary: Text An alias for the item.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Thing.Description
member.summary: Text A short description of the item.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Thing.Image
member.summary: URL to an image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Thing.Name
member.summary: Text The name of the item.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Thing.PotentialAction
member.summary: Action - Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Thing.SameAs
member.summary: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Thing.Url
member.summary: URL of the item.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Thing.MainEntityOfPage
member.summary: URL or CreativeWork - Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. Many (but not all) pages have a fairly clear primary topic, some entity or thing that the page describes. For example a restaurant's home page might be primarily about that Restaurant, or an event listing page might represent a single event. The mainEntity and mainEntityOfPage properties allow you to explicitly express the relationship between the page and the primary entity. Related properties include sameAs, about, and url. The sameAs and url properties are both similar to mainEntityOfPage. The url property should be reserved to refer to more official or authoritative web pages, such as the item’s official website. The sameAs property also relates a thing to a page that indirectly identifies it. Whereas sameAs emphasises well known pages, the mainEntityOfPage property serves more to clarify which of several entities is the main one for that page. mainEntityOfPage can be used for any page, including those not recognized as authoritative for that entity. For example, for a product, sameAs might refer to a page on the manufacturer’s official site with specs for the product, while mainEntityOfPage might be used on pages within various retailers’ sites giving details for the same product. about is similar to mainEntity, with two key differences. First, about can refer to multiple entities/topics, while mainEntity should be used for only the primary one. Second, some pages have a primary entity that itself describes some other entity. For example, one web page may display a news article about a particular person. Another page may display a product review for a particular product. In these cases, mainEntity for the pages should refer to the news article or review, respectively, while about would more properly refer to the person or product. Inverse property: mainEntity.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Action.ActionStatus
member.summary: ActionStatusType - Indicates the current disposition of the Action.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Action.Agent
member.summary: Person or Organization - The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). e.g. *John* wrote a book.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Action.EndTime
member.summary: DateTime - The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*. Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Action.Error
member.summary: Thing For failed actions, more information on the cause of the failure.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Action.Instrument
member.summary: Thing The object that helped the agent perform the action. e.g. John wrote a book with *a pen*.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Action.Location
member.summary: PostalAddress or Place - The location of the event, organization or action.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Action.ActionObject
member.summary: Thing - The object upon the action is carried out, whose state is kept intact or changed. Also known as the semantic roles patient, affected or undergoer (which change their state) or theme (which doesn't). e.g. John read *a book*.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Action.Participant
member.summary: Person or Organization - Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. e.g. John wrote a book with *Steve*.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Action.Result
member.summary: Thing The result produced in the action. e.g. John wrote *a book*.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Action.StartTime
member.summary: DateTime -The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December. Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Action.Target
member.summary: EntryPoint - Indicates a target EntryPoint for an Action.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.AchieveAction
member.summary: The act of accomplishing something via previous efforts. It is an instantaneous action rather than an ongoing process.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.AgreeAction
member.summary: The act of expressing a consistency of opinion with the object. An agent agrees to/about an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.ReactAction
member.summary: The act of responding instinctively and emotionally to an object, expressing a sentiment.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.AssessAction
member.summary: The act of forming one's opinion, reaction or sentiment.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.ChooseAction
member.summary: The act of expressing a preference from a set of options or a large or unbounded set of choices/options.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.ChooseAction.Option
member.summary: Text or Thing - A sub property of object. The options subject to this action.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.DisagreeAction
member.summary: The act of expressing a difference of opinion with the object. An agent disagrees to/about an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.DislikeAction
member.summary: The act of expressing a negative sentiment about the object. An agent dislikes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.EndorseAction
member.summary: An agent approves/certifies/likes/supports/sanction an object.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.EndorseAction.Endorsee
member.summary: Person or Organization - A sub property of participant. The person/organization being supported.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.IgnoreAction
member.summary: The act of intentionally disregarding the object. An agent ignores an object.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.LikeAction
member.summary: The act of expressing a positive sentiment about the object. An agent likes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.ReviewAction
member.summary: The act of producing a balanced opinion about the object for an audience. An agent reviews an object with participants resulting in a review.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.ReviewAction.ResultReview
member.summary: Review - sub property of result. The review that resulted in the performing of the action.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.VoteAction
member.summary: The act of expressing a preference from a fixed/finite/structured set of choices/options.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.VoteAction.Candidate
member.summary: Person - A sub property of object. The candidate subject of this action.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.WantAction
member.summary: The act of expressing a desire about the object. An agent wants an object.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.DrinkAction
member.summary: The act of swallowing liquids.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.ConsumeAction
member.summary: The act of ingesting information/resources/food.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.ConsumeAction.ExpectsAcceptanceOf
member.summary: Offer - An Offer which must be accepted before the user can perform the Action. For example, the user may need to buy a movie before being able to watch it.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.EatAction
member.summary: The act of swallowing solid objects.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.InstallAction
member.summary: The act of installing an application.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.ListenAction
member.summary: The act of consuming audio content.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.ReadAction
member.summary: The act of consuming written content.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.UseAction
member.summary: The act of applying an object to its intended purpose.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.ViewAction
member.summary: The act of consuming static visual content.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.WatchAction
member.summary: The act of consuming dynamic/moving visual content.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.WearAction
member.summary: The act of dressing oneself in clothing.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.ActivateAction
member.summary: The act of starting or activating a device or application (e.g. starting a timer or turning on a flashlight).

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.ControlAction
member.summary: An agent controls a device or application.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.DeactivateAction
member.summary: The act of stopping or deactivating a device or application (e.g. stopping a timer or turning off a flashlight).

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.ResumeAction
member.summary: The act of resuming a device or application which was formerly paused (e.g. resume music playback or resume a timer).

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.SuspendAction
member.summary: The act of momentarily pausing a device or application (e.g. pause music playback or pause a timer).

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.CookAction
member.summary: The act of producing/preparing food.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.CreateAction
member.summary: The act of deliberately creating/producing/generating/building a result out of the agent.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CookAction.FoodEstablishment
member.summary: FoodEstablishment or Place - A sub property of location. The specific food establishment where the action occurred.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CookAction.FoodEvent
member.summary: FoodEvent - A sub property of location. The specific food event where the action occurred.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CookAction.Recipe
member.summary: Recipe - A sub property of instrument. The recipe/instructions used to perform the action.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Actions.CreateActions.FoodEstablishment
member.summary: A food-related business.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.LocalBusiness
member.summary: A particular physical business or branch of an organization. Examples of LocalBusiness include a restaurant, a particular branch of a restaurant chain, a branch of a bank, a medical practice, a club, a bowling alley, etc.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Organization
member.summary: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.Location
member.summary: The location of the event, organization or action.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.Brand

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.DissolutionDate

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.Email

member.summary: Person - Someone working for this organization. Supersedes employees.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.Employees
member.summary: Person - Someone working for this organization. Supersedes employees.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.Event
member.summary: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action. Supersedes events.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.Events

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.FaxNumber

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.Founder
member.summary: A person who founded this organization. Supersedes founders.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.Founders

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.FoundingDate
member.summary: Date - The date that this organization was founded.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.FoundingLocation

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.GlobalLocationNumber
member.summary: Text - The Global Location Number (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.HasPOS

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.InteractionCount
member.summary: Text - A count of a specific user interactions with this item—for example, 20 UserLikes, 5 UserComments, or 300 UserDownloads. The user interaction type should be one of the sub types of UserInteraction.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.IsicV4
member.summary: Text - The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.Member
member.summary: Person or Organization - A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals. Supersedes members, musicGroupMember.Inverse property: memberOf.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.MemberOf

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.Naics

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.Owns

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.TaxID

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.Seeks
member.summary: Demand A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.SubOrganization

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Organization.VatID
member.summary: Text - The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.LocalBusiness.BranchOf
member.summary: The larger organization that this local business is a branch of, if any.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.LocalBusiness.CurrenciesAccepted
member.summary: Text The currency accepted (in ISO 4217 currency format).

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.LocalBusiness.OpeningHours
member.summary: Duration The opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'. - Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr, Sa, Su. - Times are specified using 24:00 time. For example, 3pm is specified as 15:00. - Here is an example: Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm. - If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as Monday through Sunday, all day.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.LocalBusiness.PaymentAccepted
member.summary: Text Cash, credit card, etc.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.LocalBusiness.PriceRange
member.summary: The price range of the business, for example $$$.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Answer
member.summary: An answer offered to a question; perhaps correct, perhaps opinionated or wrong.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork
member.summary: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.About

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.AccessibilityControl

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.AccessibilityFeature
member.summary: Text Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.AccessibilityHazard
member.summary: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3. (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values)

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.AccountablePerson

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.AggregateRating
member.summary: AggregateRating - The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.AlternativeHeadline

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.AssociatedMedia

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Audience
member.summary: Audience - The intended audience of the item, i.e. the group for whom the item was created.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Audio
member.summary: An embedded audio object.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Author
member.summary: Person or Organization - The author of this content. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Award

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Character

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Citation

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Comment

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.CommentCount

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.ContentLocation

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.ContentRating

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Contributor

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.CopyrightHolder

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.CopyrightYear

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Creator

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.DateCreated

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.DateModified

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.DatePublished

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.DiscussionUrl

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.ExampleOfWork

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Genre

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.InLanguage

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.InteractionCount
member.summary: Text - A count of a specific user interactions with this item—for example, 20 UserLikes, 5 UserComments, or 300 UserDownloads. The user interaction type should be one of the sub types of UserInteraction.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.InteractivityType
member.summary: Text - The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.IsBasedOnUrl

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.IsFamilyFriendly

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.IsPartOf

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Keywords

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.LearningResourceType
member.summary: Text - The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.License
member.summary: URL or CreativeWork - A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Mentions

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Offers

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Position
member.summary: Integer or Text - The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWork.Provider

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.CreativeWorks.Article
member.summary: An article, such as a news article or piece of investigative report. Newspapers and magazines have articles of many different types and this is intended to cover them all.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.MediaObject
member.summary: An image, video, or audio object embedded in a web page. Note that a creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio stream (2 AudioObject's).

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.MediaObject.AssociatedArticle
member.summary: NewsArticle A NewsArticle associated with the Media Object.

member.summary: Text File size in (mega/kilo) bytes.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.MediaObject.ContentUrl
member.summary: URL Actual bytes of the media object, for example the image file or video file.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.MediaObject.Duration
member.summary: Duration The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.MediaObject.EmbedUrl
member.summary: URL A URL pointing to a player for a specific video. In general, this is the information in the src element of an embed tag and should not be the same as the content of the loc tag.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.MediaObject.EncodesCreativeWork
member.summary: CreativeWork The CreativeWork encoded by this media object.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.MediaObject.EncodingFormat

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.MediaObject.Expires

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.MediaObject.ProductionCompany
member.summary: Organization The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.MediaObject.RegionsAllowed
member.summary: Place The regions where the media is allowed. If not specified, then it's assumed to be allowed everywhere. Specify the countries in ISO 3166 format.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.MediaObject.RequiresSubscription
member.summary: Boolean - Indicates if use of the media require a subscription (either paid or free). Allowed values are true or false (note that an earlier version had 'yes', 'no').

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Event.PreviousStartDate
member.summary: Date - Used in conjunction with eventStatus for rescheduled or cancelled events. This property contains the previously scheduled start date. For rescheduled events, the startDate property should be used for the newly scheduled start date. In the (rare) case of an event that has been postponed and rescheduled multiple times, this field may be repeated.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Event.RecordedIn

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Event.SuperEvent

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.BreadcrumbList
member.summary: A BreadcrumbList is an ItemList consisting of a chain of linked Web pages, typically described using at least their URL and their name, ending with the current page.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.ItemList
member.summary: A list of items of any sort—for example, Top 10 Movies About Weathermen, or Top 100 Party Songs. Not to be confused with HTML lists, which are often used only for formatting.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.ItemList.ItemListElement
member.summary: Thing or ListItem or Text - For itemListElement values, you can use simple strings (e.g. "Peter", "Paul", "Mary"), existing entities, or use ListItem. Text values are best if the elements in the list are plain strings. Existing entities are best for a simple, unordered list of existing things in your data. ListItem is used with ordered lists when you want to provide additional context about the element in that list or when the same item might be in different places in different lists. Note: The order of elements in your mark-up is not sufficient for indicating the order or elements. Use ListItem with a 'position' property in such cases.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.ItemList.ItemListOrder
member.summary: ItemListOrderType or Text - Type of ordering (e.g. Ascending, Descending, Unordered).

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.ItemList.NumberOfItems
member.summary: Number - The number of items in an ItemList. Note that some descriptions might not full describe all items in a list (e.g. multi-page pagination).

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Class
member.summary: A class, also often called a 'Type'; equivalent to rdfs:Class.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Demand
member.summary: A demand entity represents the public, not necessarily binding, not necessarily exclusive, announcement by an organization or person to seek a certain type of goods or services. For describing demand using this type, the very same properties used for Offer apply.

member.name: F:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Enumeration.ActionStatusType.ActiveActionStatus

member.name: F:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Enumeration.ActionStatusType.PotentialActionStatus
member.summary: A description of an action that is supported.

member.summary: OpeningHoursSpecification - The opening hours of a certain place.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.address
member.summary: PostalAddress - Physical address of the item.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.aggregateRating
member.summary: AggregateRating - The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.containedIn
member.summary: Place - The basic containment relation between places.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.Event
member.summary: Event - Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action. Supersedes events.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.FaxNumber
member.summary: Text - The fax number.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.GlobalLocationNumber
member.summary: Text - The Global Location Number (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.InteractionCount
member.summary: Text - A count of a specific user interactions with this item—for example, 20 UserLikes, 5 UserComments, or 300 UserDownloads. The user interaction type should be one of the sub types of UserInteraction.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.IsicV4
member.summary: Text The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.Logo
member.summary: ImageObject or URL - An associated logo.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.Photo
member.summary: Photograph or ImageObject A photograph of this place. Supersedes photos.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.Photos
member.summary: Photos.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.Review
member.summary: Review - A review of the item. Supersedes reviews.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.Reviews
member.summary: Reviews.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Place.Telephone
member.summary: Text - The telephone number.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.AggregateOffer
member.summary: When a single product is associated with multiple offers (for example, the same pair of shoes is offered by different merchants), then AggregateOffer can be used.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer
member.summary: An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service—for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book. For GTIN-related fields, see Check Digit calculator and validation guide from GS1.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.PriceCurrency
member.summary: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the price or a price component, when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.PriceSpecification
member.summary: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.AcceptedPaymentMethod
member.summary: The payment method(s) accepted by seller for this offer.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.Category
member.summary: The payment method(s) accepted by seller for this offer.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.ValidFrom
member.summary: The date when the item becomes valid.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.ValidThrough
member.summary: The end of the validity of offer, price specification, or opening hours data.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.AddOn
member.summary: An additional offer that can only be obtained in combination with the first base offer (e.g. supplements and extensions that are available for a surcharge).

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.Sku
member.summary: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.SerialNumber
member.summary: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.Seller
member.summary: Organization or Person -An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods. A seller may also be a provider. Supersedes merchant, vendor.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.Review
member.summary: Review - A review of the item. Supersedes reviews.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.Availability
member.summary: ItemAvailability - The availability of this item—for example In stock, Out of stock, Pre-order, etc.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.AdvanceBookingRequirement
member.summary: QuantitativeValue - The amount of time that is required between accepting the offer and the actual usage of the resource or service.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.AvailabilityEnds
member.summary: DateTime - The end of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.AvailabilityStarts
member.summary: DateTime - The beginning of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.AvailableAtOrFrom
member.summary: Place - The place(s) from which the offer can be obtained (e.g. store locations).

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.AvailableDeliveryMethod
member.summary: DeliveryMethod - The delivery method(s) available for this offer.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.BusinessFunction
member.summary: BusinessFunction - The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.DeliveryLeadTime
member.summary: QuantitativeValue - The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods leaving the warehouse.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.EligibleCustomerType
member.summary: BusinessEntityType -The type(s) of customers for which the given offer is valid.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.EligibleDuration
member.summary: QuantitativeValue - The duration for which the given offer is valid.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.EligibleQuantity
member.summary: QuantitativeValue - The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.EligibleRegion
member.summary: GeoShape or Text - The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.EligibleTransactionVolume
member.summary: PriceSpecification -The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.Gtin13
member.summary: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.Gtin14
member.summary: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.Gtin8
member.summary: The GTIN-8 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.IncludesObject
member.summary: TypeAndQuantityNode - This links to a node or nodes indicating the exact quantity of the products included in the offer.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.IneligibleRegion
member.summary: Place The place(s) from which the offer cannot be obtained (e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed).

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.InventoryLevel
member.summary: The GTIN-8 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.ItemCondition
member.summary: OfferItemCondition A predefined value from OfferItemCondition or a textual description of the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.ItemOffered
member.summary: Product - The item being offered.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Offer.Warranty
member.summary: WarrantyPromise - The warranty promise(s) included in the offer..

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.AggregateOffer.HighPrice
member.summary: Number or Text - The highest price of all offers available.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.AggregateOffer.LowPrice
member.summary: Number or Text - The lowest price of all offers available.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.AggregateOffer.OfferCount
member.summary: Integer - The number of offers for the product.

member.summary: Offer - An offer to provide this item. For example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, or give away tickets to an event.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Enumeration.BusinessEntityType
member.summary: A business entity type is a conceptual entity representing the legal form, the size, the main line of business, the position in the value chain, or any combination thereof, of an organization or business person. Commonly used values: http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Business http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Enduser http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PublicInstitution http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Reseller

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Enumeration.BusinessFunction
member.summary: The business function specifies the type of activity or access (i.e., the bundle of rights) offered by the organization or business person through the offer. Typical are sell, rental or lease, maintenance or repair, manufacture / produce, recycle / dispose, engineering / construction, or installation. Proprietary specifications of access rights are also instances of this class. Commonly used values: http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ConstructionInstallation http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Dispose http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#LeaseOut http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Maintain http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ProvideService http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Repair http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Buy

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Property.InverseOf
member.summary: Property - Relates a property to a property that is its inverse. Inverse properties relate the same pairs of items to each other, but in reversed direction. For example, the 'alumni' and 'alumniOf' properties are inverseOf each other. Some properties don't have explicit inverses; in these situations RDFa and JSON-LD syntax for reverse properties can be used.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.StructuredValue.PropertyValue
member.summary: A property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of a product or place. Use the 'name' property for the name of the property. If there is an additional human-readable version of the value, put that into the 'description' property. Always use specific schema.org properties when a) they exist and b) you can populate them. Using PropertyValue as a substitute will typically not trigger the same effect as using the original, specific property.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.StructuredValue.PropertyValue.PropertyID
member.summary: URL or Text - A commonly used identifier for the characteristic represented by the property, e.g. a manufacturer or a standard code for a property. propertyID can be (1) a prefixed string, mainly meant to be used with standards for product properties; (2) a site-specific, non-prefixed string (e.g. the primary key of the property or the vendor-specific id of the property), or (3) a URL indicating the type of the property, either pointing to an external vocabulary, or a Web resource that describes the property (e.g. a glossary entry). Standards bodies should promote a standard prefix for the identifiers of properties from their standards.

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.Intangible.Enumeration.PaymentMethod
member.summary: A payment method is a standardized procedure for transferring the monetary amount for a purchase. Payment methods are characterized by the legal and technical structures used, and by the organization or group carrying out the transaction. Commonly used values: http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ByBankTransferInAdvance http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ByInvoice http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Cash http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#CheckInAdvance http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#COD http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DirectDebit http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#GoogleCheckout http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PayPal http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PaySwarm

The act of playing/exercising/training/performing for enjoyment, leisure, recreation, Competition or exercise. Related actions:
ListenAction: Unlike ListenAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to performing for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming music.
WatchAction: Unlike WatchAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to showing/displaying for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming visual content

member.name: T:MXTires.Microdata.TradeAction
member.summary: The act of participating in an exchange of goods and services for monetary compensation. An agent trades an object, product or service with a participant in exchange for a one time or periodic payment.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.TradeAction.Price
member.summary:
Text or Number - The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes. Usage guidelines:
Use the priceCurrency property (with ISO 4217 codes e.g. "USD") instead of including ambiguous symbols such as '$' in the value.
Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
Note that both RDFa and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

member.name: P:MXTires.Microdata.TradeAction.PriceSpecification
member.summary: PriceSpecification - One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

Commonly used values: http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Labor-BringIn http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-BringIn http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-PickUp
